summary: This is an FBI tactical operation plan detailing the planned arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in Sutton, New Hampshire, on July 1, 2020. The document outlines surveillance, arrest procedures, personnel assignments, and contingency plans, noting Maxwell's association with Scott Borgerson and her status as a flight risk.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite and associate of Jeffrey Epstein, considered a flight risk with three citizenships, targeted for arrest in Sutton, New Hampshire.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: Described as the girlfriend of Ghislaine Maxwell and a potential person of interest, but not an alleged subject at the time of the operation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased associate of Ghislaine Maxwell, mentioned in her suspect description.

persons.name: SA Chambers
persons.context: Coordinated with the Sutton Police Department to ensure awareness of FBI operations during the arrest plan.

persons.name: ASAC Chad Creasey
persons.context: Approved the tactical operation plan on June 30, 2020.

connections.description: Described as associates, with Borgerson noted as Maxwell's girlfriend in the case background.
Maxwell is identified as an associate of the deceased Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Information received on Maxwell's location
events.description: The NH-2 and NHSSGTF received information that Ghislaine Maxwell may be located in the Sutton, New Hampshire / Lake Sunapee region.

events.title: Planned arrest operation
events.description: FBI tactical operation plan to locate and arrest Ghislaine Maxwell via federal arrest warrant in Sutton, New Hampshire.

locations: Sutton Police Department â€” 1N Road North Sutton NH 03260
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was considered a flight risk with three separate citizenships at the time of the planned arrest.
The FBI operation involved coordination between the New York Field Office, New Hampshire Safe Streets Gang Task Force, and local Sutton Police.
Maxwell's arrest was planned to occur via a 'knock and talk' or federal search warrant once her location was confirmed, avoiding vehicle traffic stops.
The document references Maxwell's association with Scott Borgerson, who was noted as a potential person of interest but not an alleged subject.
Contingency plans included procedures for medical emergencies, barricaded subjects, and extraction of law enforcement personnel.
